result.execSummary:
The defendant Franco Antonio Reyes-Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence. Release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed.  Maintain fulltime employment.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the  Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with any known illegal drug users.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
Comply with all child support Court orders.

Notify DOC agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any doctor.
Fine set at zero.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.   Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.    Must attend at least two alcohol and drug assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month.

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surchaerge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaning balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

timeConds.notes: Without good time credit.  STAYED to be used as follows for positive drug or alcohol, with release for work, and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring:  first violation to serve seven (7) days; serve 14 days for second; and 125 days for third.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Franco Antonio Reyes-Gonzalez

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT  1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least 2 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 146 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit;
 This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of positive drug or alcohol to serve 7 DAYS; with release for work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
*Second violation of positive drug or alcohol to serve 14 DAYS; with release for work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
*Third violation of positive drug or alcohol to serve 125 DAYS; with release for The Day Reporting Center, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Franco Antonio Reyes-Gonzalez in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Defendant Franco Antonio Reyes-Gonzalez in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record.   Defense counsel received discovery.  Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Franco Antonio Reyes-Gonzalez in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Nick Cerwin for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Franco Antonio Reyes-Gonzalez in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Ismael Maldonado.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/15/15 @ 1:30 pm
